taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs in rivers and estuaries (Ref. 7300, 44894).  Inhabits lakes and small streams in upland and coastal plain areas, including brackish estuaries.  Prefers the cover provided by aquatic vegetation in rocky or gravel-bottomed pools.  Only female dwells upstream; male tends to stay in the lower, estuarine reaches of rivers.  Juvenile feeds on zooplankton; adult on insects, crustaceans and fishes.  Life cycle is catadromous: flood events between May and August trigger a downstream spawning migration to estuaries.  A plant thickets and sandbars are known sites for egg deposition (Ref. 44894).  A 63 cm LCF female was caught and released in Lake Samsonvale, SE Queensland with an estimated weight of more than 4.5 kg (Stephen T. Poole, pers.comm. elops1@yahoo.com, 03/09).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Oceania:  endemic to Australia (Queensland to Victoria).
dataObjects.references: Paxton, J.R., D.F. Hoese, G.R. Allen and J.E. Hanley 1989 Pisces. Petromyzontidae to Carangidae. Zoological Catalogue of Australia, Vol. 7. Australian Government Publishing Service, Canberra, 665 p. (Ref. 7300)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.description: 60.0 cm TL (male/unsexed; (Ref. 6398)); max. reported age: 22 years (Ref. 38557)
references: Axelrod, H.R., W.E. Burgess, N. Pronek and J.G. Walls 1991 Dr. Axelrod's Atlas of freshwater aquarium fishes. Sixth edition. T.F.H. Publications, Neptune City, New Jersey.
Harris, J.H. 1985 Age of Australian bass, Macquaria novemaculeata (Perciformes: Percichthyidae), in the Sydney Basin. Aust. J. Mar. Freshwat. Res. 36:235-246. (Ref. 38557)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Migration
dataObjects.description: Potamodromous. Migrating within streams, migratory in rivers, e.g. Saliminus, Moxostoma, Labeo.  Migrations should be cyclical and predictable and cover more than 100 km.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#LifeExpectancy
dataObjects.title: Lifespan, longevity, and ageing

dataObjects.title: File:Australian bass 2.jpg
dataObjects.description: English: A large wild w|Australian bass, caught in the freshwater reaches of an East Coast river. Caught in late March (early autumn), on a lure with a w|catch and release|barbless hook, this female fish was making her way down to the estuary for winter spawning. She was carefully released after the photo.  French: Macquaria novemaculeata ou bar australien, une espèce de perche australienne.

dataObjects.title: File:Australian bass 3.jpg
dataObjects.description: English: An Australian bass caught in the freshwater reaches of a coastal river in summer. It was caught on a surface lure equipped with barbless hook and was carefully released after the photo.

agents.full_name: Original uploader was Codman at en.wikipedia

dataObjects.title: File:Australian bass.JPG
dataObjects.description: English: A magnificent wild w|Australian bass|Australian bass, caught during a canoe trip on a coastal river in New South Wales, Australia. This Australian bass was caught on a lure equipped with barbless hooks and was carefully released after the photo.

agents.full_name: Original uploader was Codman at en.wikipedia

dataObjects.title: File:Australian bass habitat — rapids.JPG
dataObjects.description: English: w|Australian bass|Australian bass are powerful swimmers and easily traverse rapids like these in their coastal river habitats. However, they require floods or freshes to drown out more significant rapids and cascades and make them passable.

agents.full_name: Original uploader was Codman at en.wikipedia
